channel.title: Buzzing on The Wall Street Journal
channel.description: 用中文浏览华尔街日报热门报道

item.title: The Australian government has declared the koala an endangered species, as habit loss, drought and brush fires have pushed the population to the edge of extinction https://t.co/1VqsFDF4h6

Dutch national flag carrier KLM halted all flights to Kyiv and said it won’t operate in Ukrainian airspace—the first major carrier to announce a halt in service as tensions between Russia and the West mount over Ukraine. https://t.co/RbHXwtKtzX
Hugo Torres, revolutionary hero, dies in Nicaraguan government custody, stoking fears for other political prisoners https://t.co/yAQCdlCqIs
Most young adults believe it’s best to delay marriage past your 20s and to live together first. New research challenges both assumptions. https://t.co/liYtQTvuCt

A secret program at the CIA relied on a form of mass surveillance activity that included the gathering of some records belonging to Americans, according to a new letter from two Democratic senators https://t.co/4ouQKnqFXd

College students have a harder time making conversation—and friends—amid a prolonged pandemic. “It feels weird to talk to anybody new without first connecting on social media,” said one. https://t.co/WUWBTbcYX4

Roughly 100 Canadian police officers have assembled in the border city of Windsor, Ontario, to begin removing protesters and vehicles that have mostly blocked traffic since Monday on a crucial U.S.-Canada trade corridor https://t.co/97CDvD8OAS
In a phone call Saturday, Biden warned Putin of “swift and severe costs” if Russia moves against Ukraine https://t.co/zJOqC31MfU

As some 130,000 Russian troops are poised on Ukraine’s borders, Turkish-made drones would offer Ukraine a tool that could offset some of Russia’s enormous military advantage (corrects typo) https://t.co/nJewCm5wdB
As the Ukraine crisis deepens, Moscow is preparing naval exercises and NATO is bolstering nearby forces https://t.co/RmCFRpqrBj

U.S. President Joe Biden and his Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin spoke on the phone for just over an hour in a last-ditch diplomatic effort to ward off military conflict in Ukraine https://t.co/jgkleFGDxh

Eteri Tutberidze has coached a string of Russian phenoms, including teenage prodigy Kamila Valieva. But her training methods have raised concerns about the welfare of underage athletes. https://t.co/Xp9SR0Mpwl
Russia’s warnings of an escalation by Kyiv in eastern Ukraine’s Donbas point to one way in which Moscow may try to recast an offensive as self-defense, Western officials say https://t.co/9fZh3WAkUX
Plenty of coffee, not enough to-go cups. A shortage of paper cups triggers a U.S. energy crisis. "A coffee shop. You expect them to have cups and lids and stuff." https://t.co/QEEpaM2Ymv
The U.S. ordered most embassy staff to leave Ukraine after warning that Russia could invade at any moment https://t.co/LBLciRTMyo via @WSJ

The banned heart drug that Russian Olympic Committee skating prodigy Kamila Valieva tested positive for is considered a risky substance that could be used to boost athletic performance under anti-doping rules. https://t.co/W12sbN1zlM

Russia has begun pulling out diplomats from Ukraine, as the U.S. Embassy suspended consular services in Kyiv and ordered most staff to depart after warning that a Russian invasion could happen at anytime https://t.co/W4nGTI3ZJr

SpaceX founder Elon Musk said the company’s Starship rocket should be able to reach orbits for less than $10 million a flight in a few years #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/FrSaJkZEEf https://t.co/QERcoNg7pV
Fewer Oreos in some packages, a 3% surcharge on a restaurant bill, no room service—companies are finding ways to pass costs on to customers without raising prices. https://t.co/tp9wzBZ42z

French researcher and Nobel laureate Luc Montagnier, who led the team that identified HIV, the virus that causes AIDS, and who more recently spread misinformation about the coronavirus, died Tuesday at age 89 https://t.co/cgzKo05Rd9

French President Emmanuel Macron is doubling down on nuclear power, betting on a technology that produces electricity with almost zero greenhouse emissions but faces questions about costs https://t.co/xwhWR5paHy

“We all used to be like brothers.” People who live in northern Ukraine and other regions bordering Russia are struggling to absorb the idea that a war with Russia could soon be coming. https://t.co/lf5DazGUKc
U.S. inflation accelerated to a 7.5% annual rate in January, rising to a new four-decade high https://t.co/H8f4H6ClYl
A Canadian judge said police can forcibly remove a group of protesters blocking access to a bridge between Canada and the U.S. https://t.co/5WrBcUnAoc
Yuzuru Hanyu finished fourth in the men's figure skating singles event at the Beijing Olympics, but the lack of a podium spot didn’t diminish Chinese fans’ ardor for him https://t.co/qRN5yYxjqJ
The Dow dropped about 500 points and oil prices climbed to a nearly eight-year high after the U.S. warned that Russia could soon invade Ukraine https://t.co/ZSvEadNmhj

The U.S. said it believes Russian President Vladimir Putin could order an invasion of Ukraine at any time and urged Americans to leave the country on their own within the next 24 to 48 hours https://t.co/fL2gsoxIUR

A Ukrainian skeleton racer held up a sign that said “No War in Ukraine” to a television camera after finishing a race Friday, bringing the first overt political statement to an Olympics that has been bracing for athlete protests https://t.co/PDr2zpZVU3
The Taliban are holding one American and several U.K. citizens in custody, people familiar with the situation say https://t.co/FjeKvABrfl

A secret program at the CIA relied on a form of mass surveillance activity that included the gathering of some records belonging to Americans, according to a new letter from two Democratic senators https://t.co/lLFpdDgGJ1
The average U.S. household is spending an additional $250 a month because of inflation that is rising at its fastest rate in nearly 40 years, a new economic analysis showed https://t.co/XyHZdHATpf

A record 31.4 million Americans plan to bet on Super Bowl LVI, a 35% increase from last year’s game. Bettors are estimated to wager $7.61 billion, up 78% jump from a year ago. The growing legalization of sports betting is fueling rapid growth. https://t.co/vBzHZ2ySBs

A secret program at the CIA relied on a form of mass surveillance activity that included the gathering of some records belonging to Americans, according to a new letter from two Democratic senators https://t.co/PZ6ijutrQV
Elon Musk says SpaceX’s massive rocket should soon be able to reach orbits for less than $10 million, a fraction of typical launch costs https://t.co/2DjhT4XRw9

The House Oversight Committee opened an investigation Thursday into Donald Trump’s handling of official records following news that 15 boxes of material were recently recovered at the former president’s Florida estate https://t.co/sBO8tz70Uj
Yuzuru Hanyu finished fourth in the men's figure skating singles event at the Beijing Olympics, but the lack of a podium spot didn’t diminish Chinese fans’ ardor for him https://t.co/YaD0ZMEoCU

Russian and Ukrainian negotiators are meeting to discuss ways to end the conflict in eastern Ukraine and a solution to the monthslong crisis triggered by Russia’s troop buildup https://t.co/oeKlHN2sr6
The average U.S. household is spending an additional $250 a month because of inflation that is rising at its fastest rate in nearly 40 years, a new economic analysis showed https://t.co/UG0XOcJUgC

During the pandemic, the National Guard has taken on roles that members never expected to find themselves filling—like eighth-grade algebra teacher. “Some kids think it’s cool. Some kids are like, ‘Oh, it’s kind of weird.’” https://t.co/Cm6DmhI9UM
A diamond that could have originated from space has sold at auction for $4.3 million to a buyer who paid in cryptocurrency https://t.co/QIO7KFNIZr
U.S. inflation accelerated to a 7.5% annual rate in January, rising to a new four-decade high https://t.co/X1WX7nluap
Nathan Chen won figure skating gold at the Beijing Olympics, delivering a rapturous free program, four years after stumbling on the biggest stage https://t.co/GLGa2wXMN6

Nancy Pelosi said she expected Democrats to soon reach consensus on restricting stock trading by members of Congress, amid debate over the scope of legislation, including whether to extend a ban to lawmakers’ spouses https://t.co/28cODDl3jy
Four years after stumbling on the biggest stage, the American delivered a rapturous free program and enters the conversation as the greatest skater of his generation https://t.co/8V6j06i9ot
An autopsy concluded that Bob Saget died in his sleep last month after suffering a brain bleed from a bump on the head, his family said https://t.co/nH2xtuXDqK
U.S. snowboarder Chloe Kim has won halfpipe gold in Beijing, defending her 2018 Winter Olympics win https://t.co/77d0bqS1px
The University of California has agreed to pay $243.6 million to settle allegations that hundreds of women were sexually abused by a former UCLA gynecologist https://t.co/cXpDeBphmC

From @WSJopinion: The lesson for the Covid-19 police is that when you’ve lost even Canadians, arguably the most law-abiding people on the planet, you’ve lost the political plot. It’s time for the pandemic emergency orders to end. https://t.co/eLQiCH0ORZ

Breaking: Barry Diller’s media group will stop publishing print editions of Entertainment Weekly, InStyle and four other magazines it acquired last year. The titles will live on digitally. https://t.co/quY2k7CJY5
Take an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal https://t.co/5xQPDPcm8q https://t.co/oswiF8lVto
